name: Attribute
description:
These **attribute selectors** allows selecting matching strings in the value of an attribute.
[info]These are the CSS2 selectors but there are also new attribute selectors in [`CSS3`](https://css4-selectors.com/selector/css3/attribute/ 'CSS3: Attribute').[/info]

sub_selectors.name: Occurs
sub_selectors.description: This attribute selector matches any element who has such a given attribute.
sub_selectors.example_description: All elements which have an `title` attribute will selected and get a black bottom border.

sub_selectors.name: Exactly
sub_selectors.description: This attribute selector matches any element which attribute value is exactly the same as specified via CSS.
sub_selectors.example_description: All elements which have an `lang` attribute to `en` will get a black bottom border.

sub_selectors.name: Whitespace
sub_selectors.description: This attribute selector matches elements which whitespace-separated attribute values are the same as specified.
sub_selectors.example_description: All elements which have an `class` attribute with an `alert` class (separated by whitespace(s)) will get a red background.

sub_selectors.name: Hypen
sub_selectors.description: This attribute selector selects all elements which hyphen-separated attribute values are the same.
sub_selectors.example_description: All elements that have an English - `en` - attribute which is or could be separated by hypens will get a blue border.
